item.title: Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition Shadow Dropped for Switch and Switch 2
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix has announced a new partnership with Aspyr by announcing Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition ports for Nintendo Switch and Switch 2.

There have been a lot of Nintendo Switch 2 ports in the news recently. One of the big ones was Grand Theft Auto 6 being tested for the Switch 2, and the other had Helldivers’ CEO commenting on the port. However, the latest news isn’t speculation; Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition has been shadow-dropped for Switch and Switch 2 and is available to purchase.

Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition Will Receive Special Discounts for Switch and Switch 2 Launch

According to the latest post on their website, the launch will provide players with several discounts, some of which can be bundled. First up is the launch discount, which will provide players 10% off on the regular price of $19.99 through November 24. Then we have the first Loyalty Discount, which provides an additional 10% discount to owners of Tomb Raider I-III Remastered on Nintendo Switch. Then the second loyalty discount is for owners of Tomb Raider IV-VI Remastered on Nintendo Switch; they can also get 10% off.

Players who own both Tomb Raider I-III Remastered and IV-VI Remastered on the Switch can grab a discount of 30% when bundling all discounts. The Loyalty Discounts will be available in the NOA Region from November 18-25, and in the NOE/AUS Region from November 21-28.

What’s Included in the Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition for Switch and Switch 2?

Apart from the optimization for the Nintendo Switch consoles, Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition features a lot of content. All DLC will be included, along with six bonus outfits for Lara, eight online multiplayer maps, and four multiplayer characters. The 8-player online multiplayer mode will be included. Lastly, there’s some digital bonus content, which features a behind-the-scenes look through digital versions of the Dark Horse comic Tomb Raider: The Beginning, the mini-art book Tomb Raider: The Art of Survival, and the “Final Hours of Tomb Raider” developer video series.

In other news, Sophie Turner has been confirmed as Lara Croft in Prime Video’s Tomb Raider. What are your thoughts on Tomb Raider Definitive Edition shadow dropping for Switch and Switch 2? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: Epic Games Store Now Allows Gifting
item.content:encoded:
Just in time for the holidays, the Epic Games Store is now allowing gifting on the storefront. The feature has been a highly requested addition from fans and couldn’t come at a better time.

Epic Games Store is a fairly new service, only launching in 2018. As a competitor to Steam, the storefront houses many popular releases like Battlefield 6, ARC Raiders, and Epic Games’ own Fortnite. However, one factor that Steam had over Epic Games Store was gifting. On Steam, you can gift a code or a copy of a game to another user. Despite a large game selection, the Epic Games Store had yet to implement the system. Now, the joy of gifting has arrived and right before the Holiday season.

Gifting Now Available to Users on Epic Games Store

In a blog post on the Epic Games Store, the company revealed that gifting has been added to the storefront. To do the process, pick a game you want to buy for someone and choose “Buy as a Gift”. From there, choose who you’ll gift the game to from your Epic friends list, and you can pick to schedule it or do it ASAP, then purchase. From there, the recipient has two weeks to accept the game. If not or rejected, you’ll get a refund.

The gifting service extends to paid games (including certain editions), add-ons, and bundles. However, in-game currency, subscriptions, free games, and pre-purchase offers are not allowed. A more step-by-step guide can be found here.

Now, you can surprise your friends with new games without any hassle. While it seems like something that should’ve been there since the start, it couldn’t have come at a better time of the year. Plus, with so many great games in 2025 like Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and Kingdom Come Deliverance 2, you can gift the best of the best to friends and finally convince them to play it.

Are you happy to see gifting come to the Epic Games Store? Will you be gifting games to your friends? What games? Let us know in the comments and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

item.title: PlayStation Black Friday 2025 Deals Revealed—Discounts on Consoles, Accessories, Games and More
item.content:encoded:
PlayStation will be coming in strong for Black Friday 2025, offering deals on PS5 consoles, accessories, games, PlayStation Plus, and more.

Black Friday 2025 deals will start kicking in for PlayStation from November 21, allowing players to explore deals for themselves and gifts from others. The deals as mentioned above will be available for PS5 consoles, games, accessories, and more that can be purchased through PlayStation Store, direct.playstation.com, PlayStation Gear, and other participating retailers.

Black Friday 2025 PS5 Bundles and Console Deals

Starting with the PlayStation 5 Console, a new Fortnite Flowering Chaos Bundle has been made available for Black Friday 2025. The PS5 Digital Edition 825GB version of this bundle will be available for $399.99 USD, and the PS5 Console 1TB version can be purchased for $449.99. The bundle offers some timed-exclusive (November 26, 2026) in-game content for PlayStation users and 1,000 V-Bucks.

Moreover, players in select regions will be able to save $100 USD on PS5 consoles, PS5 Digital Edition consoles, and PS5 Pro consoles. However, PlayStation has advised players that “Actual retailer prices and availability may vary. Products may have different sales periods. See specific offer details on product detail pages or retailer sites.”

Black Friday Deals on PlayStation Accessories – PSVR2, PlayStation Portal, DualSense and More

There are many discounts on PlayStation’s entire range of accessories for Black Friday 2025, with deals ranging from $20 USD off to $100 USD off. Check out the complete list of discounts for each product below:

  • $100 USD off PlayStation VR2
  • $20 USD off PlayStation Portal remote player
  • $20 USD off Pulse Elite wireless headset
  • $30 USD off Pulse Explore wireless earbuds 
  • $30 USD off DualSense Edge wireless controller
  • $20 USD off DualSense wireless controller
  • $20 USD off Access controller
  • Various discounts on PS5 games, including Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, Lost Soul Aside, Astro Bot, and God of War Ragnarök.

Black Friday 2025 Deals on PlayStation Plus

For PlayStation’s subscription service, PS Plus, a discount will be available for Black Friday 2025 as well. Players in participating countries can join the service for a 33% discount on a 12-month membership. Current members can also avail a 33% discount on the remainder of their membership when upgrading from PlayStation Plus Essential/Extra to PlayStation Plus Premium/Deluxe.

Black Friday 2025 Deals on Games and Gear

During the Black Friday 2025 promotion, hundreds of PS5 and PS4 digital games are available with discounts of up to 75% on the PlayStation Store. Lastly, players can save 60% off on PlayStation Gear on all merchandise, including apparel, drinkware, and more, from titles like Astro Bot, The Last of Us Part II, and God of War Ragnarök.

In other news, Battlefield 2042 and 8 other games are leaving PlayStation Plus in December 2025. Additionally, PlayStation’s senior vice president has stated that PS5’s biggest title is still to come. What are your thoughts on PlayStation’s Black Friday 2025 deals? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

item.title: EA Sports Not Releasing F1 26, Next New Game Coming In 2027
item.content:encoded:
EA Sports has announcemed that it’s not going to release F1 26 next year.

On Tuesday, it was revealed that instead of releasing F1 2026 in 2026, EA Sports will release a paid expansion for F1 25. This expansion will represent “the 2026 FIA Formula One World Championship, including new cars, teams, and regulations.”

The next game, then, is scheduled to release in 2027. EA says that the next game in franchise will be a “reimagined and more expansive EA Sports F1 game”. They said that the game will deliver a “deeply authentic and innovative Formula 1 experience.”

Questions around the future of the F1 franchise at EA have been popping up ever since the launch of F1 25. That release was scheduled to be the last of the current contract, though there was an option to extend it for two years.

EA had initially confirmed to Insider Gaming that the option was picked up to keep the franchise going. However, just hours later, the company retracted that confirmation saying, “Apologies for the inconvenience, but we’ve been informed that the information we provided earlier today is inaccurate and we don’t have any information at this time.”

Since then, it had been silent from EA and Formula 1 on the state of the series and F1 26. Until now, that is.

Insider Gaming has reached out to EA and Formula 1 for added context on the decision to not release a game next year. Should a response be received, it will be added to this story.
